problem_text: This is a GeomVerse problem. If the ABCDE shape is a rectangle where an equilateral triangle has been removed from one side of it, the perimeter of the ABCDE shape is 60 and the area of the BFGC square is 121, compute the length of the AB side of the ABCDE shape. Round computations to 2 decimal places.
code:
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.patches as patches
import numpy as np

# Coordinates
A = (34.23, 34.23)
B = (34.23, 13534.23)
C = (11034.23, 13534.23)
D = (11034.23, 34.23)
E = (5534.23, 9560.51)
F = (34.23, 24534.23)
G = (11034.23, 24534.23)

# Create the figure and axis
fig, ax = plt.subplots(figsize=(8, 16))

# Draw the cyan polygon (A, B, C, D, E)
cyan_polygon = patches.Polygon([A, B, C, D, E], closed=True, color='cyan', alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(cyan_polygon)

# Draw the red polygon (B, F, G, C)
red_polygon = patches.Polygon([B, F, G, C], closed=True, color='red', alpha=0.6)
ax.add_patch(red_polygon)

# Draw right-angle markers
def draw_right_angle(ax, p1, p2, p3, size=0.5, color="gray", alpha=0.8):
    '''Draws a right-angle marker at the corner defined by p1, p2, and p3.'''
    v1 = np.array(p1) - np.array(p2)
    v2 = np.array(p3) - np.array(p2)
    v1 = v1 / np.linalg.norm(v1) * size
    v2 = v2 / np.linalg.norm(v2) * size
    marker = patches.Polygon(
        [p2, p2 + v1, p2 + v1 + v2, p2 + v2],
        closed=True,
        facecolor=color,
        edgecolor=None,
        alpha=alpha
    )
    ax.add_patch(marker)

# Add right-angle markers
draw_right_angle(ax, A, B, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, C, D)
draw_right_angle(ax, B, F, G)
draw_right_angle(ax, F, G, C)
draw_right_angle(ax, G, C, B)
draw_right_angle(ax, C, B, F)

# Add labels
ax.text(A[0], A[1], "A", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="top")
ax.text(B[0], B[1], "B", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(C[0], C[1], "C", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")
ax.text(D[0], D[1], "D", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="top")
ax.text(E[0], E[1], "E", fontsize=16, ha="center", va="bottom")
ax.text(F[0], F[1], "F", fontsize=16, ha="right", va="bottom")
ax.text(G[0], G[1], "G", fontsize=16, ha="left", va="bottom")

# Configure the plot
ax.set_xlim(-4965.77, 15034.23)
ax.set_ylim(-4965.77, 30034.23)
ax.set_aspect('equal')
ax.axis('off')

# Show the plot
plt.show()

ext_info.cot: The area of the BFGC square is 121, so the length of the BC side is $\sqrt{121} = 11$. The side of the equilateral triangle in the ABCDE shape is equal to the side of the rectangle with length 11 and the shape has two rectangle sides with equal but unknown lengths, one rectangle side with length 11, and two triangle sides with length 11. The perimeter of the shape is 60 so $2 * OtherSide + 3 * 11 = 60$. So $2 * OtherSide = 60 - 33 = 27$ and the length of the AB side is $\frac{27}{2} = 13.5$. Therefore the final answer is 13.5.
